attributes.action: Council must serve notice of any consultation directly on all residents by post
attributes.additional_details: Luton Borough Council has failed in it's duty to provide proper notice of proposals and consultations that would introduce new legislation affecting the residents of Luton. The Council have either failed to provide proper and accurate information to residents or failed to ensure the ease of access to such information on all proposed consultations.
attributes.background: During the recent proposed introduction of Selective Licensing, the Council failed to provide proper notice of proposals or consultation to all residents affected by the introduction of such a policy. We believe that there should always be a transparent and independent consultation undertaken.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This decision is the responsibility of Luton Borough Council. 

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: 

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

If you have made a complaint to the council, and you are not happy with the way it has been handled, you may be able to complain to the Local Government Ombudsman: 

http://www.lgo.org.uk/make-a-complaint

You could also start a new petition asking the UK Government or Parliament to require all English local authorities to notify residents of consultations by post.
